summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell, informing her that enclosed discovery materials pertinent to her case are being provided. It is official correspondence related to the discovery process in her criminal prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of the certified mail letter, identified as an inmate at MDC Brooklyn, to whom discovery materials are being sent in relation to her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter, authorizing the transmission of discovery to the defendant.

connections.description: Strauss, as the U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority corresponding with the defendant, Maxwell, regarding the provision of discovery in her criminal case.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials via certified mail to Ghislaine Maxwell at her detention facility.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
MDC Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center, P.O. Box 329002, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence dated October 4, 2021, from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell.
It confirms that discovery materials pertinent to Maxwell's case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330) are being provided to her.
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the MDC Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center under registration number 02879-509 at the time.
The letter is signed by United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, indicating her office's direct involvement in the prosecution's discovery process.
